Comparison with Harry Reid: One aspect employed to verify the authenticity of the claim is the comparison of the voting attendance records of the three GOP House members (Paul Broun, Phil Gingrey, and Jack Kingston) with that of U.S. Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid. The claim states that Reid has a better voting attendance record than these three Congressmen.
Use of Govtrack: us: The nonpartisan website Govtrack.us was used as the basis for the claim. This website logs the votes of each member of Congress and indicates when they didn't vote. By utilizing this source, the claim attempted to provide objective data to support its assertion.
Percentage of votes missed: The claim mentions the percentages of votes missed by each congressman, as reported by Govtrack.us. This aspect aimed to provide a quantitative measure of their voting attendance records and compare them to the congressional median of 2.3 percent.
Comparison of voting frequency: PolitiFact Georgia conducted an apples-to-apples comparison of the voting records of the four men from the same time period (July 2007 onwards). This comparison revealed that the three Georgia members had voted nearly three times as often as Reid since July 2007. This aspect aimed to provide a broader context and highlight the difference in voting frequency between the House and the Senate.
